headline: The Cold War Ends in Liquid: Europeâ€™s SAIX Initiative Breaks Ground on Chillerless Infrastructure
body: As 2025 dawns, the Great Code Walls of the Pacific have effectively severed the global internet. Within this fractured landscape, the Sovereign AI Exchange (SAIX) has officially launched its five-year mandate to secure European digital independence. Director-led efforts are pivoting away from traditional data center designs, leveraging technological shifts toward higher operating temperatures to eliminate massive chiller plants entirely. By embracing direct-to-chip liquid cooling and the 45C signal, SAIX aims to slash infrastructure CAPEX, allowing a limited budget to stretch across the continent. This shift marks a departure from reliance on legacy hardware standards, positioning Europe to survive the digital winter by mastering the heat of the new silicon.
flavor: In the silence of the new digital divide, the sound of rushing coolant is the only pulse of a continent reclaiming its future.
